Review.Titre: Warning - they can not fulfill Peru eSims but will sell you one
Review.Contenu: As a single woman traveling solo in Peru for the first time, having cell service is important. I purchased my eSim which stated it would be available in less than 2 minutes. I have been unable to get a eSim from them and 2 days later I have cancelled my order and selected a different carrier. A carrier I'm using to write this review from Peru. When I asked Maya why they still hadn't provided an eSim and when I could expect one they simple stated"Thank you for contacting us. I am happy to help.  We are currently awaiting a restock of the eSIM you ordered. The order will be provisioned automatically when the eSIMs are available. In the meantime, I will be consulting our internal team for an update on the same.  You will receive an email with the activation code and instructions as soon as the eSIM is ready. We appreciate your patience and we will have this ready for you as soon as possible."Which is of zero help and offers no timeline. Their order page for Peru STILL says you will get your eSim within 2 minutes. This is very deceptive and leaves travelers frustrated at a time we would rather be having fun that chatting with Customer Service who offered zero help at all.

Review.Titre: Buyer beware: this could ruin your phone
Review.Contenu: I attempted to load the eSIM on my unlocked iPhone 13 Pro. Got a message that the SIM was not supported which prevented me from getting into Settings to rid myself of it. I was in setup purgatory. After hours on the phone with Apple and my carrier (including an hour in my carrier's store), no one could solve my problem and I now seem to have a $1200 paperweight. Maya's support was unable to do anything either. At least I got my $18 back so I didn't *pay* to ruin my phone. Good luck out there.EDIT: just to be clear, I'm not stuck on the settings screen, I'm stuck in the initial setup that adding the eSIM to my UNLOCKED phone (purchased full price directly from Apple that's been working great for a year and a half) initiated. I can't get to settings. I can restart — indeed, I can factory reset! — but it just takes me back to the "Hello!" screen and when I hit the activation phase, the SIM fails and my only options are to try again or go back (which means try again). Five senior Apple advisors so far have scratched their head at this. I'm not saying that Apple bears no responsibility here (pretty clearly if scanning a QR code from the settings can brick your phone, that's bad design), but Maya needs to advise users better about the risks of their product and perhaps how to look in advance for possible hold ups. Had I known that this was even a remote possibility, I'd probably not tried to save a few bucks on my trip and just used my carrier's international rates. Now I'm out the cost of a pricey smart phone.

Review.Titre: It’s a very unreliable service in…
Review.Contenu: It’s a very unreliable service in Israel, it stops working every ten minutes and you need to restart the e-SIM all the time. Customer service responds to complaints but fails to live up to what they promise to deliver so it’s useless to complain. Once you pay it’s a gamble, if it doesn’t work right then there’s nobody to fix the issue. I would definitely not recommend this service.Edit: During the process of my complaints, the Maya team informed me they issued a new e-SIM as it was clear the issue was not fixable, but the e-SIM never arrived. Upon my inquiry as to why I have not received the new e-SIM, their response was that it looked like I had used the 3GB internet, so instead, they offered an extra 1GB on the same e-SIM. By the time this was done, my stay in Israel was almost over, and I had deleted the e-SIM, so it was useless for me. I never said I could not use the internet - I could use it, but I had to restart the e-SIM constantly for it to work, which was very inconvenient. If I did not use the phone, the internet simply stopped working so I could not really receive messenger texts, WhatsApp, and other communication while offline, so I had to restart the phone again to check if I had missed calls or messages on those apps. I stand by what I am saying and I have evidence of the correspondence, otherwise, if everything went fine I would not write this review.

I bought an Asia Pacific plan. I installed it as per instructions. But when I arrived Australia it didn't work. I was asked to make sure my roaming was on and my phone setting set to primary.  I was asked to change from Telstra to Optus. I couldn't do it. Maya did it for me. I thought I had a connection and used it when I was outside my rented apartment which had WiFi. To my amazement my phone was barred after a few days.  On  returning home I went to my service provider and they told me that my roaming was on and I was using my home service provider and not Maya. I had exceeded my credit limit.  I had to pay almost US$60.  I looked through the intructions given and discovred that different people gave different  instructions.  Think carefully before using Maya.  But I must say the personnel answered my questions promptly but my problem was not solved, It is unlikely that I will use an eSIM plan again. It was a costly first time experience.This was your instructions to me. To leave the roaming ON.In your phone's Settings, go to Cellular and select the eSIM data plan under Cellular Plans. The eSIM plan may be called "Secondary" or "Personal." Make sure Turn On This Line is set to ON.Make sure Roaming Data is set to ON.

Review.Titre: The worst ever eSIM I have used
Review.Contenu: The worst ever eSIM I have used. I got a eSIM for Asia Pacific valid for 30 days as I was travelling to singapore, Thailand and Vietnam. I activated my eSIM in London( where I’m based) . The sim didn’t work when I landed in Singapore. After a lot of back and forth with the customer service, they issued me a new eSIM which started working. After three days in singapore, I land in Thailand, the sim was working again. When I logged in and check, I was issued singapore only sim, instead of apac, so again after following up with customer care, they issued a apac sim. The next 11 days in Thailand was ok. Ok the last day, the sim stopped working again. I have been following up with customer care and there is absolutely no response. This day was very important and I had to arrange taxi etc. And also i land in Vietnam that day i badly wanted the internet connection. I must have sent at least 10 emails and absolutely no response. I had no option but to buy another eSIM. Absolutely horrible customer service and absolutely horrible eSIM. I have used a fair few eSIM but this is definitely the worst. Stay away.Edit: i understand that there was some network failure. But what was stopping you from responding to our emails for so long. Or better , what was stopping you from sending out emails to all your users when you realised there was this issue? Instead of just stranding us without any clue.

Really mixed experience with Maya Mobile. Took out the APAC+ plan to cover travel to Bali and Singapore. The SIM installation process is pretty simple, but does require 2 devices as you need to scan a QR code on the device you want the SIM to work on.Was all set up before I took off for Bali so expected data to be available when I landed.Unfortunately, it took about 4 days and many messages back and forth to get the connection working. Eventually I was provided a new QR code and once this was installed the connection worked great.I had a second SIM for a trip to Kochi in India and this worked perfectly within the first hour of landing.Then on to Singapore and again have spent 5 days going from WiFi to WiFi and continuously requesting support from Maya mobile. This support has been very friendly and professional, however woefully inadequate.I eventually gave up in Singapore and switched to Airalo which worked immediately.So, all in all, a very mixed experience.

This review is related only for LatinSIM option in Costa Rica.I decided to go for maya.net because I‘m planning to stay a couple of weeks in LatinAmerica and the data plan sounds great. No border issues, easy eSIM activation process, searching for the best mobile net etc. So far so good. I also had first experience in Mexico with maya.net. After first problems, it worked quite good. The maya.net customer service is amazing.BUT!I moved on to Costa Rica and decided to switch from local country data plan to LatSIM data plan.I‘m currently using it for about 2 weeks and can say that the mobile net is pretty bad… I‘m always getting LIBERTY and it seems to be the worst. I met many people getting KOLBI or CLARO. They are very pleased with fast connection.I was traveling through San José, Guapiles, Limon, Puerto Viejo… Many cities… And everywhere I’m getting stuck, experiencing slow connection, not only in rural region, also in San José…That might be also the the reason why 70% of my 3GB data plan is gone. It takes a long time, and I‘m using only google maps sometimes and internet research. No videos, no videocalls, no ICloud synch. Just surfing.To be honest, the data plan is not the cheapest compared to the physical SIM cards, you can buy.But the fact that maya.net says, they choose the best mobile net, was the reason using this provider.Summary:- Excelent Customer Service.Fast and customer friendly.- inadequate mobile net supply.In the end, this is decisive for my review only rating 2 of 5 points.Too bad…

Review.Contenu: I’ve been using wi-fi most of the time, yet somehow burned through 2.5GB of data in just one week. 😢 I only turn on the data at night for about 7 hours, when I don’t have wi-fi.

Review.Titre: As a new user of an eSIM
Review.Contenu: As a new user of an eSIM, it was pretty confusing and I didnt like that there was no app to track it

Everything was fine with purchase and set up. Easy and great communication. Sim card was ready to go when I arrived. However, the coverage in London was not great and internet was often slow when my local friends could use their internet with ease.

Bought a Maya e-sim for both Malaysia and Indonesia, easy installation but unfortunately I had a lot of problems with my data connection in Indonesia. It only worked when I turned on my 4G, but after a few seconds I lost connection again. However, 4G in Malaysia worked perfectly. Costumer care is good, they reply very fast and are willing to help.
Use hola pay, more expensive but at least you get unlimited data. I’ve used Maya half day and it’s already almost gone (1 giga to be fair).It does work smoothly apart from the consumption.

Review.Titre: First time; not bad  but it could have been better
Review.Contenu: Honestly it was first time for me and I was not so familiar with the eSIM in itself. I had to work out the activation with some difficulties.However I found the functionality not stable.Expecially saturday I experienced problems all along the day. Monday was definitely better.

There was no indication on your website that your E Sims would not work with a locked phone. Didn’t discover that until I was already in country and had to scramble to make other arrangements. The reason for the three stars is because I was able to give the code to another colleague, however, they said the Internet service was very slow.

Review.Titre: Ok, but pricy, not the best reception in the shipyard area
Review.Contenu: It is good, but expensive, a friend of mine got an unlimited data plan for 20€, in the same area, I’ll change to that one when my month finishes.
Slightly difficult to set up not just me some of the rest of the group & when checking on usage of data it said 0% used then suddenly 70% used!?

Review.Titre: Easy setup is the only positive thing about this
Review.Contenu: The setup was easy. The connection over the esim is not great unfortunately. I have to keep turning mobile data of and on and in some areas it doesn't work, even though it looks like I've got full reception (LTE). So probably wouldn't get it again, only in an emergency.
Support and directions for use with google phone or I phone is sketchy and confusing! Never live support. The chat feature is useless. A rabbit hole!

The service was easy to book and install because it is very well described by the provider. However, the network coverage was bad. Maya advertises T-Mobile/AT&T in the US, but compared to a real T-Mobile eSIM, the Maya eSIM had a less network coverage and was sometimes also not available in Los Angeles (why?). Summary: Good for travelers, who want/need to be online direct after arriving in the country of destination. Bad for travelers, who want/neet good network coverage (=> just go directly to a local provider).

The service itself works well (in Greece), quite easy to set up from the QR code. The customer service, on the other hand, is tragic. My phone (Samsung A 54 5G) does not exist in the list of compatible ones on the Maya website. I therefore sent a question to the service to see if it would work on the Maya network. I received a reply that this phone does not support esim cards. What nonsense!!! I already had an esim card installed in this phone before. Out of curiosity I bought a small top up in Maya and by all means it works!!! Incompetent people!!! That's why for the service itself 5* and for the service 1*.

Review.Titre: Be aware of the time difference
Review.Contenu: I had activated esim in advance before departure in order to use the mobile when I arrived in Tokyo.I couldn't use it till next day because of the activation time was the standard American time or whatever its called. I'm sure there are some people like me. A bit more explanation on this point might be helpful.Otherwise the connection is excellent.
Random unexplained complete outage for half a day during usage period so far.

Review.Titre: The website itself was easy to use and…
Review.Contenu: The website itself was easy to use and to put the eSim onto you’re phone.However the data signal itself has been a little iffy.Sometimes no signal at all to access data, possibly due to where we are staying in Turkey.

Price is good but I had a hard time connecting to network. I followed the instructions provided by Maya but failed to connect until the 3rd day of my trip when it randomly started working. It was practical for the time it worked but really inconvenient that I could not rely on it. I am unlikely to rely on esim again for future trips.

Review.Titre: Unlimited is not worth it after 30gb
Review.Contenu: I purchased the unlimited data package and it worked well without any issues… until. The problem was that - and I was aware of this - after 30gb of usage they reduce your data speed. This made surfing the web excruciatingly slow, and often had me wishing I had used another company. I knew about this an expected it to come, but it was a harsh reduction in speed. Another thing Maya did - which I was not aware of - was block certain applications on my phone after 30gb of usage. This was annoying. The reason I went with Maya was because of the option to use a hotspot, but I would not recommend them if you plan to use more than 30gb with the unlimited package.

Service was not available throughout the country of Costa Rica. Generally, Maya would become famous if it offered partial refunds to customers who bought more GB than they used. I bought five and used less than one. Offer a partial refund on your esims, please.

Great when it works. Not best for Saudi. Best to get physical sim from STC once in country as you get more data and inclusive call minutes.I did find changing data settings from LTE to 3G improved data reliability!
Data doesn’t always work, sometimes need to restart the phone so you can get a connection - usually after leaving a wifi zone. Otherwise, good value.
Doesn't work properly in Columbia. Even if your phone says you have a signal you actually don't. Customer service is quick, but couldn't help either. Has been working well in Mexico so far.

Review.Titre: Purchased two esims for a trip to…
Review.Contenu: Purchased two esims for a trip to Guatemala. Upon arrival the sim in iPhone 12 worked fine on the Tigo network. Continued to work fine with mostly LTE coverage. No issues using the esim in Guatemala on iPhone 12. Unfortunately the esim on iPhone 13 did not work with iMessage or FaceTime. It initially did work for web browsing, then abruptly stopped working altogether. Maya mobile was not able to resolve the issue, but did refund. I don’t think this is an issue with the esim or Maya Mobile necessarily. I think it’s an Apple issue as other esim users have had similar experiences. Ended up purchasing a regular sim from a Tigo vendor in Antigua for less and it worked no issues. If you have an iPhone, it might work, or it might not. Maya will refund you if it doesn’t work though, so it’s worth a shot. If it works, it’s easier than having to buy a sim and swap.

I needed to be able to text to verify my identity to login to home apps , but cannot due to data only , so some issues for us as a couple, so next time would buy one Maya data and one locale sim so we can receive text .

In total - good service. For a few days experience problems with the internet connection. It was very slow and took a lot of time to load pages and google maps. But then suddenly the situation changed and for the last 4 days of the trip, the internet was perfect at all times.

Review.Titre: Good deal but below average connection.
Review.Contenu: Being connected the moment we landed in London is the best thing about Maya. However, we lost coverage multiple times during our visit in London and that frustrated us a little.

Review.Titre: I chose maya mobile for my trip to Egypt
Review.Contenu: I chose maya mobile for my trip to Egypt and it was a good fit. Activation at the airport was not immediate but overall I was satisfied with how it worked even though from Luxor to Aswan there was not much mobile network

in comparing with another website, youre programm is quite expensive. i would continue in using different website, because they have unlimited data for 20chf, but i have some technical problem here. but otherwise is your programme very well beside of the price

Review.Titre: Very easy to use data across Europe
Review.Contenu: The e-sim was very simple to activate and worked straight away once I reached Europe. Phone calls can be problematic - check with your service provider beforehand and check you won’t get charged. But data works effortlessly, just disable the primary sim.
Easy to setup. Good coverage. Sometimes speed is limited even though good signal.
Wonderful for travelers. Something you must do before your trip with all security.

Had no problems so far!I bought a APAC package to travel through Singapore, Malaysia, Indonesia and Taiwan. I'm only through Malaysia so far but I've had no issues with service so far - and the price is very competitive with the other eSIM options I've found. If I have good experience with all the countries I'm planning on going to, then this is definitely 5 stars!

Worked well, as expected - would definitely use again as they have better deals than my current provider! EU sim even worked in the UK, which I wasn’t expecting. Could do with clearer instructions how to set up, but thankfully I’d used an eSIM before so was fine Sent A LOT of spam emails after I’d signed up.
Great option, but I feel like the connection is not as strong as getting a regular SIM card. Overall I am happy with the product.

Maya is truly remarkable product. To just be able to go online, choose a plan, add the esim to my phone and have instant data is amazing. To be able to change from country to country if I like so I get the best access to networks when I travel. The only thing I feel is missing is the ability to manage all of this in an app. This would make it perfect.
Everything worked perfectly but could be a little cheaper

Review.Titre: The process is simple and reliable
Review.Contenu: The process is simple and reliable. Communication from Maya.net is precise and acurate.reason for 4 star is that communication in rural areas and safari reserves in South Africa is negligible.rest everything is all good

I have booked Asia eSim. It worked right from the start, when we arrived in Bangkok. I had little difficulties when putting on the expansion, for another 15 days. Maybe about 12 Hours it constantly went on and off. Now it works fine again.
Some hassle during activation but then working fine (Argentina, Chile, USA, Aruba).
Easy to set up, worked well, only slow sometimes. Not 5g fast but still  functioned well. Less than 5 stars because too many spam emails afterwards with promos, offers etc.

Review.Titre: At times the speed felt a little…
Review.Contenu: At times the speed felt a little throttled and slow. However nothing unmanageable and this was temporary, for the bulk of the time it worked well and as advertised

Review.Titre: The service worked as promised and was…
Review.Contenu: The service worked as promised and was easy to install. I would appreciate to have plans for whole two weeks instead of just five days to be prepared for the complete vacation.
It’s not so expensive and it’s easy to activate. The only thing is sometimes it doesn’t have a signal or it’s slow but it works. Would still recommend it.

*update*Maya team immediately fix the issue. Good customer serviceI  signed up for 3GB for 5 days. And on day 4 I wasnt able to access the internet, I checked my account and it shows 1.96 GB used. So basically I still have almost 1.1GB left. Never again with Maya!!! I was out in Yerevan Armenia and I couldn’t get a taxi because of this!!!!!
Great and quick onboarding. The setup was super easy an quick. I take one star off because often in downtown London I didnt have internet eventhough signal strenght was at it highest

Review.Titre: I'm very happy with my purchase of two…
Review.Contenu: I'm very happy with my purchase of two e Sims from Maya Mobile. I would like a bit better price, but everything else is OK. The Sim cards worked as expected and accessing my profile is easy and straight forward. I'm still Maya Mobile customer and  my intention is to continue use Maya Mobile

Review.Titre: No way to recharge if you are out of data
Review.Contenu: The connection is fast but sometime need to restart by turning the esim card setting on/ off. If you have ran out of data you will be cut off without warning, you can’t recharge esim without an Internet connection. It will be difficult until you can find a store with free WiFi to login maya to recharge. Maya should provide a connection just for recharging.

Easy to use, value for money. Connection so far is always excellent. The one negative experience is that a lot of Apps don’t work at all, which is a shame because I was prepared to spend money on it on a regular basis but won’t be now if my favorite Apps are being blocked

I used maya, bought 20GB, they sent me email 70% of data is used, I checked my Maya account and it showed I used 15.2Gb but anyway not possible to connect Internet without WiFi. I contacted them, had to wait for answer but on the end,in 24 hours they sorted out the problem. But have to say, on same money I can buy sim card in Turkey and will have some free minutes and texts
The data worked quite well, but some apps (like Teams) were not usable.Moreover the procedure for the activation was quite difficult, especially for Android.Overall, however, the opinion is positive.

Review.Titre: Recommended for Turkey, but not for Uzbekistan
Review.Contenu: I bought an e-sim package for Turkey and for Uzbekistan (I was using a Samsung Galaxy S23). In Turkey, it worked like a charm (and it's much chaper than buying a physical tourist-simcard in the country). Can definitely recommend it for Turkey.In Uzbekistan on the other hand, I kept losing the connection and the internet was extremely slow, I would say around 90% of the time I was without connection. Support was'nt really helping, they just replied with standardized answers/tips you can also find in their FAQs. Buying a physical sim card is much cheaper and will provide you with faster and most importantly reliable internet connection. No recommendation for use in Uzbekistan!Update 08.10.2023: I received a refund from Maya for the Uzbekistan data package - added one star for their support!

Quite easy to buy and upload. Not completely intuitive and it took a couple of tries to get it right but once installed it worked really well.  Used it on an 11 day holiday to Turkey, so outside the EU, and therefore not covered by our usual phone contracts. It doesn’t cover phone calls and texts but data and email covered everything needed while away.
Every thing is fine. Connection is easy and got supported. you didn't have a lical number. That can be difficul perhaps fo unsing grab.

All worked well, connection was reasonably simple albeit trial and error, instructions need to be clearer, more detailed. Allowed us to use WhatsApp for calls, it’s a shame it’s only a data ESim and did not include voice.My biggest concern was the dramatic increase in junk mail while using the ESim Overall though good price for the data required and worked well

Review.Titre: Easy to use and I can share internet with my other devices
Practical when on the go with a foreign…
Review.Contenu: Practical when on the go with a foreign telephone and steep roaming charges.

Works, value for money, Esim easy to activate . However my regular sim seems no to be receiving text/sms with after e Sim had been activated.In some parts of London coverage is not great ie Covent garden area. So far otherwise ok

Works well. Used the eSIM while in the UK. Instructions were clear and initial connection was seamless. After that though, I experienced some issues with the connection; no internet connection, limited coverage... At a point I wondered if I was out of data, checked my account and saw I hadn't even used up to 50%. Restarted my phone and that helped. I restarted my phone I few more times when I experienced the lack of or limited internet connection. Those moments were frustrating but overall, using Maya was convenient.

Review.Titre: Super easy to use and activate
Review.Contenu: Super easy to use and activate.4 stars because one evening the data stopped working and I assumed it had run out but I received no explanation from the company, would’ve been nice but not necessarily expected.I’d definitely use the company again.

Great easy app, works really well Only have package valid for 30 days , still have one gig available and need it but cannot extend.Should be able to use within EU not get separate SIM for each country and cannot transfer daya that already paid for

I bought the unlimited data pack for Italy because I work a lot with my laptop and I have been travelling for 2 months here. It worked well until I reached 30GB (in 2 weeks), then it became slower and it worked well only for emails. Due to the fact that this product was not what I thought it was, I requested a refund. This was granted to me after a bit of back and forth to explain the misunderstanding, therefore I am happy with the outcome.

The connection was not always available. My roaming provided more broad connectivity than Maya, but it didn't give me much trouble since most places worked fine. The internet speed was good.I had a hard time during the initial setup because the terms described in the documentation, like settings menu item names, needed to be correctly named for Samsung Galaxy S23 (in particular, there is no Cellular menu option on my phone settings page). I had to do additional research to be able to complete the setup.

The whole buying proces was very quick and easy. The data was immediately activated when I arrived in place. Also they have different options to tell you what to do when the internet is running slow or doesn’t work. Unfortunately my internet runned very slow a few times a day. Not sure if it’s because I was in a place with slow data or when I traveling in the bus? Overall great experience and will use it again for sure.

I think the app is fantastic and very practical but I would like it to work for all smartphones and not such new versions (such as from the iPhone 11 onwards). For example, my parents came to visit Europe and they were very excited to use this system but they couldn't because my mom has an iPhone 7 and my dad has an iPhone 6. That was very sad. Everything else is fine.

Connection was slowly at different times of days. Don‘t know of it depended on turkish mobile phone network or something else. Installation was easy and helpful explained. App could help monitoring usage instead of website login. Finally it worked and was suitible for me.

Traveling through California(USA)This eSIM is a great alternative to using my own SIM and avoid the ROAMING CHARGES. CONVENIENCE- eSIM provide quick online install avoiding physical SIM (which you need to purchase ahead of time). AVERAGE DATA SPEED piggybacking on major cell company in the area. *I did get some spotty signals but overall good coverage in metropolitan areas. Outside cities are not as reliable. Main use for the esim is for GPS maps and chat APPS like FB messenger and Viber. **Make sure you turn off your other SIM or eSIM to avoid charges. Set your cellular data setting so APPS and mail(push) don’t get used on the background.  I learned that the hard way as my data got depleted. Overall I would use this company again.

I'm going to give 4 because I'm not sure if the problems I got were not available. First, I had bad connection in the North of Wales, although it's covered in the map on the website. Also, I felt my 3gb expired very quickly.

Review.Titre: eSIM is a game changer; tho have some concerns
Review.Contenu: An eSIM is really a game changer, and I was excited to give this a try. And mostly, it was great! Easy to install, got me data in most places most of the time, and the prices are reasonable. Some concerns though: -I have an iPhone and it totally messed with my iMessages and contacts. I didn't get a bunch of messages, group chats were unusable, and people's name/photos weren't showing up. There was no easy solution to this- I read the FAQ's and even contacted customer support. Maybe user-error, but if so I can't be the only one? -The data went conspicuously fast. I'm super careful about streaming, uploading photos, etc and it went much, much faster than predicted based on my typical usage. Maybe I was on weak internet and it pulled from data sometimes? I tried to turn off data when on wifi, but it didn't seem to matter much. Spent twice what I anticipated.

Review.Titre: Very easy, but not really on an android phone
Review.Contenu: It was not difficult to install the simcard and also the payment went well. Except when you have an android phone it doesn't show up right away. That ofcourse is not maya mobiles fault, but maybe you can give instructions to make it work on a android phone. Thanks!

Review.Titre: Quick pick up of network in NZ
Review.Contenu: Quick pick up of network in NZ, however instructions wasn't clear on how to activate it. I had to disable my existing sim to get full service from Maya. Network coverage was good as well.

Review.Titre: Very easy to register and receive the…
Review.Contenu: Very easy to register and receive the esim card. Instruction for the installation could be a little more detailed for Samsung. Connexion is working very well with good speed.
Worked great in Turkey. However prices are higher than expected so consider buying a cheap local SIM. If you need eSIM only and don't need really big packet, Maya is really a good option.

Review.Titre: I really like the fact that you don’t…
Review.Contenu: I really like the fact that you don’t have to physically buy a SIM card so I could book it from the Wi-Fi hotel I was staying in. It’s easy to manage and they send you all details on how to do the configuration on your cellphone.

Review.Titre: Maya coverage in Northern Europe and…

Review.Titre: Easy to install and works well

After that it has connected execpt one time after being on a hotel wifi I needed to turn airline mode on and off to connect again (to a different network)

Esim was working well. The only issue I had with the plan was about its initial setup. There’s no clear instructions about how to set up the esim. I was charged $15 roaming fees on the first day of my travel by my primary line provider because of faulty instructions from Maya as it said I can leave my primary line on. Maya needs to revise their instructions wholly.

It is an easy way to cross borders and there is no need to buy a physical Sim-Card. It is easy, to choose your Data Plan und pay with PayPal. You get your QR-Code immedatly via Email. But there are problems to scan the QR Code from the Email  via screenshot with my Android Galaxy S22 cellphone directly. Wenn the E-Sim was installed correctly at the end, there was another problem with the possibilty to promt the correct APN, that is given in the Email. These problems are more or less problems of the users side. Now,after the knowledge of the single steps I could recommend the completion by Maya

Review.Titre: I was on vacation in Brazil with my…
Review.Contenu: I was on vacation in Brazil with my girlfriend in the winter of 2023. We both bought an esim from Maya. Everything was fine for about one week then I experienced problems (I was connected but could not use data and, hence, no internet connexion). I use an Android Pixel 3XL (and my girlfriend uses Apple iPhone and had no problem whatsoever).I made several different attempts to resolve the problem myself. We finally gave up and decided to use customer service. Which is what I should have done in the beginning... It was no biggie and everything was resolved within minutes. Quick and efficient customer service obviously. Thumbs up!

In Kuala Lumpur the connection was good, no complains about it. In Indesia the connection was not that great, but the service of Maya is really good. They fixed the problems I had and kept in contact with me if I have any other problems.

Reliable 4G connectivity for the most part, although occasionally it drops to 3G outside urban/town areas (Nova Scotia, Canada.) Overall, it is great, and for a very reasonable price. I would definitely use their service again.

In Nicaragua it would have been cheaper to get a local SIM card. But the fact that you can buy, download the Maya eSIM and set up everything in 5 min while being in the airport wifi is a BIG comfort and advantage which is the reason I'm giving 5 stars. Plus, they are transparent and tell you right away that the service is NOT a subscription. No scam or hidden payments. Yey! Good job, Maya!

Review.Titre: No Netflix service, then all fixed!
Review.Contenu: Connection works fine, but I paid unlimited data to watch netflix, and I just discovered that the website is completely blocked. It should have been mentioned.Edited:After 4 days, internet access went completely down and my unlimited plan changed state to "no data available" and I had to recharge it!!I've contacted the support and quickly restored it and now even netflix is available!I'm not sure what happened (they thought I was in France), but in the end great and quick support.There might be always issues with the technology, but I think you can trust a service based on their support team.For this reason I change my review to 5 stars.

On landing at Antalya Airport I turned my phone on, but i didnt get any network signal. Thinking it was a settings issues i accessed the sim manager to check, only to find my phone (Samsung S21) froze, several reboots later and the phone failed to respond to attempts to access sim manager. I left my phone whilst we left the airport to hunt down our transfer to the southern outskirts of Side / Manvagat. About 15mins into the journey i noticed my phone had gained a signal for the e-sim. After which I enjoyed the next 10 days  of network data. I've scored Maya 5* as it may have been my own impatience that caused the issue rather than the network as after I got connected I had no further issues. I even got a message when my data was 50% used which was handy too. Ordering and Setting up the initial esim was easy to do, with Maya offering the best value esim.
